intro: Cirrhopetalum sutepense, commonly known as the Sutepense bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes, thriving in cool and humid climates. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Cirrhopetalum sutepense is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
